div1.head: Letter from James H. Pou to Henry Rose Carter, July 3, 1915
div1.opener:
CAPITAL CITY PHONE 322
PRACTICE LIMITED TO MATTERS OF IMPORTANCE
C. A. GOSNEY, NOTARY PUBLIC,
CONVEYANCES AND DEPOSITIONS.
JAMES H. POU,
LAWYER--GENERAL PRACTICE,
ROOMS 210 AND 211 TUCKER BUILDING
Raleigh, N. C., July 3rd, 1915.
Dr. H. R. Carter,
Lock No. 17,
Tuscaloosa, Ala.
My dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
I have your favor of the 27th of June; and I
have submitted the same to Mr. Tillery. I enclose you herein
Mr. Tillery's reply. He thinks that one further examination
is all that is necessary; and I expect he is right. He thinks
you are the man to make it; and I know he is right in that.

We are, therefore, going to trust that you can make
arrangements to come the latter part of July, as you suggest;
and we promise to do everything in our power to make your
stay comfortable; and to furnish you every facility possible to
enable you to make a thorough examination. If you feel
like bringing any person with you to assist you, or take part
in the examination, you are authorized to make such arrangement
with such person as you think proper; and we will gladly
perform any agreement you may make in that respect.
With much respest and best wishes, I am,
